New Records: Giancarlo Stanton hit a 446-foot home run in the 3-2 count, which was the fourth slider he had seen from Bibee on the night.
Key Match Events: Bibee remained in the game despite facing the top of the Yankee order for a third time, and Stanton hit a home run off him in the 6th inning.
Soto worked a masterpiece of an at-bat against Gaddis, fouling off pitch after pitch, and eventually hitting a home run to clinch the game for the Yankees.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt had a lightning quick hook during Games 1 through 4, pulling his starters after 2.2, 1.1, 5.0, and 2.1 innings in each respective game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees won their first pennant in 15 years due to the Guardians' inability to handle the dual familiarity effects that plague every team over the course of a long playoff series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees managed to get four outs of Tim Hill, who pitched in every game of this series, and also got four massive outs from Jake Cousins, a relatively fresh arm the Guardians had hardly seen all series.
Others: The Guardians' bullpen was tasked with covering six or seven innings per night, with the Guardians' top arms being asked to face the Yankees' hitters again and again over the last week.
